name: Colorful Thoughts: An Art Collection by Sachind John
locationName: Sublime Inspiring Awe, Vittal Mallya Road Karntaka bangalore
description:
No of People Coming: Unknown At an impressionable age of three, Sachind used his imagination to draw fish and thus began his artistic journey. At the age of nine he drew a cockerel for a school assignment and he was reprimanded by his teacher because she was sure he had traced it. Being a lover of animals he used water colors to bring out the beauty of their creation.

Vehicle body styling and product designing fascinated his teen years. Unaided by any formal training, Sachind worked alone at his skill. His perfectionist nature, with an eye for detail, keeps him working on every dot and line of his artwork. His inherent interest in art and design caused him to also pursue graphic design and civil architecture. He designed the home of his parents, friends and also the home he now resides in.

name: Urbanization and the Fate of Small Farmers by Prof.Amit Bhaduri
locationName: Ginserv Auditorium Global Incubation Services, CA Site No:1, Behind Hotel, Leela Palace Kempinski, HAL 3rd Stage, Kodihalli, Karntaka bangalore
description: No of People Coming: Unknown  About the Talk Development has become synonymous with urbanization. Urbanization is widespread in India with nearly 42 % of its people to live in cities by 2030. While urban demand for food is supposed to get good prices for farm produce, cities also take land and water away from agriculture. All these affect the lives of small holders across the country who form 85% of our farming community. The talk will explore this phenomenon and explain the link between the political issue of agrarian distress on the one hand, and the problem of increasing degradation of urban environment on the other. About the Speaker  Amit Bhaduri has served as Professor of Political Economy at the University of Pavia, Italy, Reader at the Delhi School of Economics, and Professor at the Indian Institute of Management, Calcutta. locationName: L165, 1st Floor, Sri Gayathri Complex, HSR layout, Sector 6 Green Bubblesbangalore
description:
No of People Coming: 13 Have an idea and how to proceed? worried if there is a market for your idea? want to understand how to convert your idea to a workable business model?

Then this workshop is for you

Register here: https://in.explara.com/e/lean-startup-workshop-opbmifny93hb45m

Lean Startup is changing the way new products are built. When used effectively, you can create better products faster, without wasting any time, money or talent building products that won?t succeed in the market.

A hands-on workshop will give practical tools and techniques for applying lean startup and customer development to your Product.

Upon leaving the workshop, you will have a practical understanding of:

-How to document your idea in a single page

-The Build-Measure-Learn approach that characterizes Lean Startup methodology

- How to define your hypotheses, design experiments with some of your key customers and developed a minimum viable product

- Run an experiment, measure it and decide whether to pivot or persevere

name: IAM: Best Practices, Policy Language & Federation
locationName: #259,2nd Main, 6th Cross Rd, Indiranagar 1st Stage, Karnataka 560041 YourStory Media Pvt Ltdbangalore
description:
No of People Coming: 105 Topic: IAM top 10 best practices

With running of your operations on AWS comes the responsibility of ensuring the security and access control among other things. More often than not, users have too much permission than what is required to do their job. This talk takes you through the top 10 best practices for Identity and Access Management (IAM) that help you to stay secure.

Topic: IAM Federation

Once your AWS footprint grows and if you are tasked with managing multiple AWS accounts and lots of different users on each of those accounts, access control will become a challenge in itself. This talk explores the options available for federating access to AWS using your own user database. We will also cover in some depth the SAML based federation to AWS. We will use FreeIPA as a user database and demo couple of scenarios.

Speaker : Prashant Bapat, APIGEE

Topic: Become an IAM Policy Ninja

 What are Managed Policies, Inline Policies, Resource Based Policies ?

 How to test IAM Policies w

name: Email Marketing and Lead Generation!
locationName: #45, DTDC Courier Office, Millers' Road, Vasanth Nagar Social Cutlet Officebangalore
description:
No of People Coming: 21 Most Indian businesses understand email marketing as buying a database of people and spamming them about their offers or profile.

If you are doing it and don't see it working, here's why:

1. Spamming is Unethical and Unpleasant.2. Databases/email lists can be purchased but there's no guarantee they would be accurate.3. Gmail, yahoo and other email service subscribers are strict about anti-spam and more and more unsolicited mails are getting bounced. So most of them don't even reach Inbox!4. The open rate is merely 1%! That's negligible and you don't even know if it's the right audience!

Does it mean email marketing is dead?

Far from that!

We'll talk about how to generate your target audience emails and how to convert them into paying customers!

With these practices, the email open rates can be as high as 75%*.

Let's discuss the more in the Meetup. Like I always say, come with questions!

Whether your are B2B or B2C, real estate or E-commerce, it's for you! 

Best,Aayush.

name: Discuss books on Mythology

No of People Coming: 13 As literature, the mythology offers complex, engaging, and often amusing entertainment. Even the brutal stories of Oedipus ,Orestes or Karna became famous standalone works of literature engaging readers for decades. The scientific aspect of the myths is most visible in those that attempt to explain certain phenomena Procne and Philomela (why the swallow has no song), and Hercules at Gibraltar (how the Rock of Gibraltar appeared) are classic examples.

The mythology also tries to answer a question that straddles the line between religion and morality. In this world, morality is cast in religious terms. Most of the best known mythslike those of The Mahabharata, Baldur, the Trojan War, deal with the cruelty and pain that even the greatest heroes face. Such stories make sense of the worlds senseless cruelty, demonstrating that, for whatever reason, the gods necessarily maintain a place for suffering in the world.

Do join us for the AMA session with Kris that will follow this event. Registration for the AMA is mandatory and you can register here

name: Deep Dive: Demystifying IoT for the Smart Home
locationName: 3rd floor, Brigade South Parade, Near Trinity Metro, MG Road, Ulsoor, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001 Amazon Web Services, bangalore
description:
No of People Coming: 100 There are myriad opportunities to improve our homes and our lives by leveraging IoT to create smarter homes, but real solutions in the market are few and far between. Is it because we do not have compelling usecases? Is technology the bottleneck? Is it more of a market readiness issue right now? At this meetup, we will examine the dynamics of the smart home, and learn from the experiences of IoT startups, builders, designers, and users.

Agenda:

* Tea at the MediaTek Labs experience zone

* Introduction to smart home and IoT - Overview of opportunity and usecase identification

* Challenges holding back smart home implementations - Panel discussion with designer, builder, IoT startup and investor

*Technology in smart home solutions - Design considerations and selection of technology for smart homes

* Rapid prototyping and product development - Building your prototype in limited time using MediaTek LinkIt Smart 7688 platform and moving towards productization

name: Erlang Supervision Trees
locationName: CA Site #1, HAL 3rd Stage, Behind Leela Palace, Indiranagar, Bangalore 560008, Bangalore Ginserv Incubation Centrebangalore
description:
No of People Coming: 13 Agenda - 2 hours

We will be starting a series of meetup on Erlang topics which are important to effectively program in Erlang. The focus will be on most used features of Erlang which are difficult for beginners and not present in many other languages. The first meetup in this series will be on supervision trees which helps bring fault tolerance, recovery and robustness to erlang applications.

1. Supervision Trees - Introduction

2. Supervision Trees - Code Examples

3. Supervision Policies & Strategies

- Discussion - tea, coffee

We have meeting room with capacity of around 9 people, based on number of interested people we will plan other venue. Join us to understand or discuss the power of Erlang, one feature at a time.

name: Current Opportunities in Residential IOT(Home Automation)
locationName: Hosur Road, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095 91 Spring Board, 4th Floor Salapuria Towers, Next to Forum Mallbangalore
description:
No of People Coming: 84 India's Real-Estate industry is growing very fast and they all are looking for USPs to differentiate themselves from each other. Home Automation has the potential to be that differentiator. It also can provide enormous benefits to the home buyers in terms of optimizing their resource utilization, knowing more things about their own house and contributing to our PM Modi's smart city initiatives. It may also bring other benefits which we haven't discovered yet.

Therefore we are starting this initiative to support Residential IoT initiatives and create an environment for collaboration between both demand and supply side. Some IoT companies and Real-estate companies have already shown interest for such an initiative.

More details to follow soon..
